channel.title: Core Web Technologies :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: The World-Wide Web was the brainchild of Sir Tim Berners-Lee. It was conceived as a way to share information across the Internet; in Sir Berners-Leeâ€™s own words describing the idea as he first conceived it: This project is experimental and of course comes without any warranty whatsoever. However, it could start a revolution in information access. Clearly that revolution has come to pass. The web has become part of our daily lives.
